SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

dxf2svg.animation
Class SvgAnimator

java.lang.Object
  dxf2svg.animation.SvgAnimator
Direct Known Subclasses:
SvgAnimator.SvgSet
public class SvgAnimator
extends java.lang.Object

This class creates animation objects depending on the type of animation required. Use the factory method getInstanceOf(int) to get an animation object. Here are the different types of animate objects that are currently supported:

  • animate
  • animateMotion
  • animateColour
  • animateTransform
  • set

For ease of debugging the implementing application if any attribute gets an illegal value an exception is thrown. This is done to stop processing rather than letting a subtle error slip by as a default value for the attribute.

Animation in SVG is based on the SMIL specification.

Version:
0.01 May 9, 2003
Author:
Andrew Nisbet
See Also:
SMIL

Nested Class Summary
protected  class SvgAnimator.IllegalAttributeValueException
          This Runtime exception gets thrown if the value passed to an attribute is not defined in the DTD.
protected static class SvgAnimator.SvgAnimate
          This class represents and encapsulates the <animate> element.
protected static class SvgAnimator.SvgAnimateColour
          This class specifies a colour transfromation over time.
protected  class SvgAnimator.SvgAnimateMotion
          This class will animate an object with motion attributes.
protected static class SvgAnimator.SvgAnimateTransform
          The animate transform element animates a transformation attribute on a target element, thereby allowing animations to control translation, scaling, rotation and/or skewing.
protected static class SvgAnimator.SvgSet
          This class is an encapsulation of the animation element <set>, not to be confused with SvgCollection or java.util.Set.
protected  class SvgAnimator.UndefinedAnimationClassException
          This exception gets thrown if the animation object requested hasn't been defined yet, or is not part of the SVG w3.org specification at the this time.
protected  class SvgAnimator.UndefinedAnimationTargetAttribute
          This exception is thrown if the target attribute of the animation is required but is not specified.

Method Detail

getInstanceOf

public SvgAnimator getInstanceOf(int type)
This factory method returns the appropriate object, depending on the the requested type of animation.

setAdditive

public void setAdditive(java.lang.String additiveValue)
Sets the additive attribute. Valid values are:
  • REPLACE (default)
  • SUM

setAttributeType

public void setAttributeType(java.lang.String type)
Sets the type of attribute you would like to animate. Valid values are:
  • CSS
  • XML
  • auto (default)

setFrom

public void setFrom(java.lang.String from)
Sets the from attribute's value.

Throws:
SvgAnimator.IllegalAttributeValueException - if the argument string is null. If the argument String is empty '""' then the attribute is set to its default state and will not be output.

Sets the by attribute's value.

Throws:
SvgAnimator.IllegalAttributeValueException - if the argument string is null. If the argument String is empty '""' then the attribute is set to its default state and will not be output.

Throws:
SvgAnimator.IllegalAttributeValueException - if the argument string is null. If the argument String is empty '""' then the attribute is set to its default state and will not be output.

SvgAnimator.IllegalAttributeValueException - if the argument string is null. If the argument String is empty '""' then the attribute is set to its default state and will not be output.

setCalcMode

public void setCalcMode(java.lang.String calc)
Sets the calcMode attribute. Valid values are:
  • DISCRETE = 110;
  • LINEAR = DEFAULT;
  • PACED = 112;
  • SPLINE = 113;

public void setPath(java.lang.String path)
Sets the path attribute's value.

Throws:
SvgAnimator.IllegalAttributeValueException - if the argument string is null. If the argument String is empty '""' then the attribute is set to its default state and will not be output.

Throws:
SvgAnimator.IllegalAttributeValueException - if the argument string is null. If the argument String is empty '""' then the attribute is set to its default state and will not be output.

setRotate

public void setRotate(java.lang.String rotate)
Sets the rotation of target animation object in relation to the path it is being animated along. Used in AnimateMotion object only.

setMPath

public void setMPath(SvgMPath mpath)
Sets an mpath sibling element on a AnimateMotion object.

setTransformType

public void setTransformType(java.lang.String type)
Sets the type of transform required of the AnimateTransform object. Valid types of transformations are:
  • TRANSLATE
  • SCALE
  • ROTATE
  • SKEW_X
  • SKEW_Y

getAnimationTargetAttribute

public java.lang.String getAnimationTargetAttribute()
Returns the name of the attribute that is the target of the animation. Example: if you wish the fill of an object to change colour on a click, then the object will return 'fill' as its target attribute.

Returns:
Attribute Target attribute of the animation object if any, see SvgAnimator.SvgSet.getAnimationTargetAttribute().

setTo

public void setTo(java.lang.String to)
Sets another attribute's value temperarily, for the course of the animation.

Throws:
SvgAnimator.IllegalAttributeValueException - if the argument string is null. If the argument String is empty '""' then the attribute is set to its default state and will not be output.

setRestart

public void setRestart(java.lang.String value)
Sets the restart attribute. Valid values are:
  • ALWAYS (default)
  • NEVER
  • WHEN_NOT_ACTIVE

Throws:
SvgAnimator.IllegalAttributeValueException - if the argument is not defined in the DTD.

setFill

public void setFill(java.lang.String value)
Sets the fill attribute. Valid values are:
  • REMOVE (default)
  • FREEZE

Throws:
SvgAnimator.IllegalAttributeValueException - if the argument is not defined in the DTD.

setBegin

public void setBegin(java.lang.String begin)
Sets the animations begin value. Valid values could be times or CSS attributes or what-have-you.

Throws:
SvgAnimator.IllegalAttributeValueException - if the argument string is null. If the argument String is empty '""' then the attribute is set to its default state and will not be output.

setDur

public void setDur(java.lang.String dur)
Sets the animations duration value.

Throws:
SvgAnimator.IllegalAttributeValueException - if the argument string is null. If the argument String is empty '""' then the attribute is set to its default state and will not be output.

setEnd

public void setEnd(java.lang.String end)
Sets the animations end value.

Throws:
SvgAnimator.IllegalAttributeValueException - if the argument string is null. If the argument String is empty '""' then the attribute is set to its default state and will not be output.

setRepeatDur

public void setRepeatDur(java.lang.String repeatDur)
This method sets the repeat duration of the animation.

Throws:
SvgAnimator.IllegalAttributeValueException - if the argument string is null. If the argument String is empty '""' then the attribute is set to its default state and will not be output.

setRepeatCount

public void setRepeatCount(double repNum)
This method sets the repeatCount attribute of an animation object causing it to loop for a repeatCount number of times.

Parameters:
repNum - The number of times the animation is to loop. If the argument is less than zero the animation will loop indefinitely.

setRepeatCount

public void setRepeatCount(java.lang.String repStr)
This method sets the repeatCount attribute of an animation object causing it to loop for a repeatCount number of times.

Parameters:
repStr - The number of times the animation is to loop. If the argument is less than zero the animation will loop indefinitely.
Throws:
java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the argument does not parse to a double value.

setAttributeToAnimate

public void setAttributeToAnimate(java.lang.String attrib)
Sets the animation's target attribute value.

Throws:
SvgAnimator.IllegalAttributeValueException - if the argument string is null. If the argument String is empty '""' then the attribute is set to its default state and will not be output.

getContent

public void getContent(java.lang.StringBuffer buff)
This method returns the content of a animation object, if any. If there is no content then an StringBuffer is returned untouched.

addContent

public void addContent(java.lang.String c,
                       byte instruction)
Allows elements to set or add content.

Parameters:
instruction - What to do with the argument. Valid values are:
  • ADD adds the argument to exisiting content.
  • SET replaces any previous content with argument string.
  • RESET deletes any content; ingores argument string.

getAttributes

public void getAttributes(java.lang.StringBuffer buff)
Outputs the element as an attribute String instead of a discreet XML element. This method will output all relavent attributes with the exception of those that have been set to SVG's default values.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Outputs the animation element tag(s) and content, if any.
